title: BUG: convert_keras imports tf2onnx first and tests afterwards if it is installed
body:
# Describe the bug
In [convert_keras](https://github.com/onnx/onnxmltools/blob/adc41eeb8ce69396970b7c79ba9a218d8a7e20bc/onnxmltools/convert/main.py#L43)

Current code:
```python
    else:
        # For tensorflow>=2.0, new converter based on tf2onnx.
        import tf2onnx

        if not utils.tf2onnx_installed():
            raise RuntimeError('tf2onnx is not installed. Please install it to use this feature.')
```

Code as is should be:

```python
    else:
        # For tensorflow>=2.0, new converter based on tf2onnx.

        if not utils.tf2onnx_installed():
            raise RuntimeError('tf2onnx is not installed. Please install it to use this feature.')

        import tf2onnx
```


Plus

```python

        if default_batch_size != 1:
            warnings.warn('default_batch_size is not supported any more. Please set it to 1.')
occurs twice in the same file on line 52 to 55.
```

It should be removed once.




# Urgency
None

# To Reproduce
Don't install tf2onnx and run convert_keras

# Additional context
This bug should be resolved very easily for somebody who has already setup this repository including test setup. Thank you for doing this for me.
